Ask HN: Reasonably Priced MongoDB GUI?
text:
I'd like a MongoDB GUI tool with query autocomplete but can't find anything that doesn't have ridiculous pricings (Studio 3T for example is great but $200 a year is way above my price range, it's more expensive than a full IDE like Intellij).

Is there something reasonably priced out there? Or if it's pricey, at least something that's "buy once, keep it forever"?

title: Ask HN: How can I start a business to generate electricity?
text:
I know that the capital costs for building a working power plant of any kind are pretty high. However, I still want to learn and see what is possible.

1. What is the thinnest vertical slice of end-to-end power-generation functionality that an individual would be able deploy and maintain on their own?

2. What are the names of necessary things that I would need to learn and research?

3. What parts are too easy to dismiss early on, but are likely to bite me later on?

Show HN: An RSS aggregator with productivity and retention in mind
text:
Hello HN !

I'm the founder of https://symfoz.com which is basically a RSS aggregator that allows people to partition the content they want to see in dedicated spaces called "Playlists", thus reducing the time needed to find the information they need.

Why Symfoz instead of other RSS aggregators ?

- Create playlists of content, avoid mixing too many feeds in the same place. You know where everything is. - Follow people or playlists, people can create some playlists with AWESOME content, you may benefit from it. - We handle classic RSS feeds, but also Youtube channels, Twitter feeds, Spotify Podcasts, sub-reddits. - An easy UI interface (This is still WIP, UI is very hard haha) - Promote retention of information by allowing people to take notes (not highlighting but really take notes), instead of just consuming content and forget it. You'll be able to find your notes easily.

A bit more about the project (you can skip this!), this is a side project that I've been working on for almost a year. I'm a back-end developer and the stack runs in Python. If you'd like more details, please feel free to ask, I'll be glad to answer !

Thanks for taking the time to read this, feel free to give any feedback, I would be really grateful :) !

title: Ask HN: What's Your Favorite Novel?
text:
While many enjoy those non-fiction technical reads, there's more to life than that! What other (i.e. fiction) books does the HN community like?

My personal favorite is definitely Cat's Cradle (Vonnegut), but Kafka On The Beach (Murakami) has become my close second.

Ask HN: I am looking for a reply to me and can't find it
text:
I have a serious medical condition and have noticed that when I do stuff, two days later is MUCH harder on me than the day after. And at some point someone on HN said something to me along the lines of "Oh, yeah, runners all know that two days after a hard run is much worse than the day after."

I don't know if it was under this handle or under my old handle of Mz. I've been searching for terms like "48 hours" and "two days" and this handle and finding nothing but outrage fuel that I have no desire to continue wallowing in.

If you got nothing better to do, you can consider this to be your good deed for the day.

Let the crickets chirping begin.

Please and thank you. (Yes, I'm in a bad mood. I feel awful today and it's part of WHY I am looking for this old comment.)
